title: Adds the president of NYSERDA and the commissioner of economic development to the New York state foundation for science, technology and innovation board
summary: Adds the president of NYSERDA and the commissioner of economic development to the New York state foundation for science, technology and innovation board and removes the executive director from such board; decreases the amount of appointed members from five and three to four and two.

       Introduced  by M. of A. GABRYSZAK, SCHIMMINGER -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Corporations, Authorities and Commissions

       AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation  to  adding  the
         president  of  NYSERDA and the commissioner of economic development to
         the New York state foundation for science, technology  and  innovation
         board and removes the executive director from such board

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 3 of section 3151  of  the  public  authorities
    2  law,  as  amended  by  section 1 of part CC of chapter 59 of the laws of
    3  2006, is amended to read as follows:
    4    3. Membership. The  voting  members  of  the  foundation  board  shall
    5  consist of: the [executive director of the New York state foundation for
    6  science,  technology  and  innovation]  PRESIDENT  OF THE NEW YORK STATE
    7  ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY, OR HIS OR  HER  DESIGNEE  AND
    8  THE  COMMISSIONER  OF  ECONOMIC  DEVELOPMENT, OR HIS OR HER DESIGNEE who
    9  shall be [a] permanent [member] MEMBERS of the foundation  board,  seven
   10  members  from  the private sector, two of whom shall be appointed by the
   11  temporary president of the senate, two of whom shall be appointed by the
   12  speaker of the assembly, and three of whom shall  be  appointed  by  the
   13  governor  with  the  advice and consent of the senate, provided that all
   14  seven members are employed within the private sector throughout the time
   15  of their appointment to  the  foundation  board.    The  private  sector
   16  members shall demonstrate leadership and expertise and be broadly repre-
   17  sentative  across  different  business  sectors  of  the state and shall
   18  include, but not be limited to representatives of the  industrial  tech-
   19  nology  research  and development sector, small business high technology
   20  sector; minority and women business  enterprises,  the  venture  capital
   21  industry;  [five]  FOUR additional members shall be appointed from among
   22  the academic, government, and workforce development sectors, [three] TWO
   23  of whom shall be appointed by the governor, with the advice and  consent

    1  of the senate, one of whom shall be appointed by the temporary president
    2  of  the senate, and one of whom shall be appointed by the speaker of the
    3  assembly; and representatives of the  regional  partnerships  as  estab-
    4  lished  in  this  section  shall also serve as non-voting members of the
    5  board, provided that each partnership shall nominate one of its  members
    6  to serve as a non-voting member of the board. All members of the founda-
    7  tion  board shall serve at the pleasure of the appointing authority and,
    8  notwithstanding any other provision of law, shall be subject to sections
    9  seventy-three and seventy-four of the public officers law. The chair  of
   10  the  foundation  board shall be appointed by the governor from among the
   11  private sector members with the advice and consent of  the  senate.  All
   12  other  officers  of  the  board  shall  be elected from among the voting
   13  members of the board of directors by  the  majority  vote  of  currently
   14  serving  voting  members of the foundation board. The executive director
   15  of the foundation shall be appointed by the governor,  with  the  advice
   16  and consent of the senate. [The executive director of the New York state
   17  office  of  science,  technology  and academic research shall become the
   18  interim executive director of the foundation, and shall be the executive
   19  director of the foundation until the executive director of  the  founda-
   20  tion  is  appointed  by the governor, with the advice and consent of the
   21  senate. The members of the New York state office of science,  technology
   22  and  academic  research  advisory  council shall serve as interim voting
   23  members of the foundation board until the appointing authority  appoints
   24  voting  members  of the foundation board. Nothing contained herein shall
   25  prohibit a member of the New York state office  of  science,  technology
   26  and  academic research advisory council from being appointed as a voting
   27  member of the foundation board by the appropriate appointing authority.]
   28    S 2. This act shall take effect on the sixtieth  day  after  it  shall
   29  have become a law.
